newsitem.title: GERMANY: German bourse says IBIS DAX level incorrect.
newsitem.headline: German bourse says IBIS DAX level incorrect.

text.p: The German bourse said late Friday that the German IBIS DAX index was currently incorrectly calculated due to a computer systems fault.
"We are experiencing technical problems in calculating the IBIS index level, but all the levels for the individual shares are correct," said a bourse spokesman.
The IBIS DAX popped to 6,106 points, registering about an 80 percent rise, shortly around 1500 GMT.
The bourse said it was handling the problem and should have the situation cleared up soon.
